required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Office Hysteroscopy in Infertility Work-out: the Role of Endometrial Hyperplasia in Southern Italian Women
clinical_study.official_title: Office Hysteroscopy in the Infertility Work-out: the Role of Endometrial Hyperplasia in Southern Italian Women

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the prevalence of endometrial hyperplasia (EH), endometrial intraepithelial neoplasia (EIN) and endometrial carcinoma between obese and not obese women undergoing IVF techniques for primary or secondary infertility.

detailed_description.textblock:
Endometrial cancer and pre-neoplastic diseases represent the most incident gynecologic malignant pathologies found in women.1 Although diagnosed in postmenopausal patients, it can be also found in younger patients, especially when associated with some risk factors. Those include weight gain and lifestyle habits, such as consumption of fatty foods that increase estrogen levels. The positive association be- tween infertility and EC is well established. Infertile women with irregular menstrual periods, oligomenorrhea, or chronic anovulation have a risk of developing
A prospective cohort study conducted at "Fertility Center, OB/GYN Unit, Department of Woman, Child and General and Specialized Surgery, University of Campania "Luigi Vanvitelli", Naples, Italy".

secondary_outcome.measure: Operator's learning curve with cumulative summation test (questionnaire)
secondary_outcome.description: assess the learning curve (LC) using cumulative summation test for learning curve (LC-CUSUM).

arm_group.description: Women with a diagnosed primary infertility undergoing hysteroscopy before IVF.
Women with a diagnosed secondary infertility undergoing hysteroscopy before IVF.
Women with recurrent miscarriages undergoing hysteroscopy before IVF.

study_pop.textblock: Southern Italian women eager for children who are set for infertility work-up at a tertiary university hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women undergoing office hysteroscopy prior to IVF techniques
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe comorbidities (i.e. cardiac, metabolic, neurologic diseases)

facility.name: Department of Woman, Child and General and Specialized Surgery, University of Campania "Luigi Vanvitelli"
